frame.name: Preventing
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or an <fen>Agent</fen> (via their actions) keeps an <fen>Event</fen> from taking place. Unlike in the Thwarting frame, the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> does not directly prevent the actions of an individual, but rather affects the world in such a way that an <fen>Event</fen> cannot occur. Some lexical units, like <t>avert</t> and <t>avoid</t> indicate that the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> would have been affected if the <fen>Event</fen> occurred. <ex> <fex name="Preventing_cause">Rain</fex> <t>prevented</t> <fex name="Event">the ball game</fex> <fex name="Event">from taking place</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Preventing_cause">He</fex> could have <t>stopped</t> <fex name="Event">the riot</fex> .</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Preventing_cause">The government</fex> narrowly <t>averted</t> <fex name="Event">a coup</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Preventing_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the agent which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.</def-root>
